story.text: (Adds Marsh & McLennan, Lennar and others)Jan 2 (Reuters) - The following bids, mergers, acquisitions and disposals involving European, U.S. and Asian companies were reported by 2100 GMT on Tuesday: ** Financial services company Marsh & McLennan Cos. Inc. (MMC.N) has agreed in principle to sell its Putnam Investments unit to Power Corp. of Canada (POW.TO) for $3.9 billion, according to sources familiar with the situation. For more details click on [nN02477868] ** U.S. home builder Lennar Corp. (LEN.N) and LNR Property Corp., a holding of Cerberus Capital Management, said they are selling a 62 percent stake in their LandSource joint venture to MW Housing Partners for cash distributions totaling more than $1.3 billion. [nN02318893] ** Canada's Harris Steel Group Inc. HSG.TO said it had agreed to a C$1.25 billion ($1.07 billion) takeover by U.S. steelmaker Nucor Corp. (NUE.N). [nN02320915] ** A logistics subsidiary of U.S. railroad Burlington Northern Santa Fe Corp. BNI.N said that it has acquired Pro-Am Transportation Services Inc., which had revenue of about $25 million in 2006. [nN02324342] ** Shipping company EGL Inc. EAGL.O said Chief Executive Officer James Crane and private equity firm General Atlantic LLC have offered to buy the company for $36 per share in cash. [nN02337360] ** American Financial Realty Trust AFR.N said it sold the State Street Financial Center, a one-million-square-foot office building in Boston, to an affiliate of private real estate investment firm Fortis Property Group for $889 million. [nWNAS6551] ** Portugal's competition authority has approved Spanish media group Prisa's (PRS.MC) 420 million euro ($557.8 million) bid for the remaining shares of Media Capital (MCP.LS), Prisa said. [nL02922097] ** Public Service Enterprise Group Inc. (PEG.N) said a subsidiary of it would sell an Indiana facility to a unit of American Electric Power Co. Inc. (AEP.N) for $325 million and take a related charge of 83 cents a share in the fourth quarter. [nSP304751] ** Bahrain-based investment bank Investcorp INVB.BH said it agreed to buy energy and construction inspection services firm Moody International Ltd. for $311 million from Close Brothers Private Equity. [nL02872855] ** CheckFree Corp. CKFR.O, a maker of software for online bill paying, said it agreed to buy Carreker Corp. CANI.O for $206 million to expand its payment processing and consulting services to the financial industry. [nN02229488] ** Titanium Metals Corp. TIE.N said it sold its 43.7 percent stake in Valtimet SAS to ValTubes SAS for $75 million cash and will record a related pre-tax gain of about $39 million in the fourth quarter. [nWNAS6547] ** French seamless metal tubes specialist Vallourec (VLLP.PA) said it raised its stake in the Valtimet joint venture with Timet to 95 percent by buying Timet's 43.7 percent for $75 million. [nL02896968] ** Troubled frozen snack producer CoolBrands International Inc. COBa.TO continued to divest assets, announcing it has entered a pact to sell its yogurt division for $45 million in cash. [nN02286422] ** Water utility Aqua America Inc. (WTR.N) said its Aqua New York Inc. subsidiary acquired New York Water Service Corp., which serves about 135,000 residents in Nassau County, Long Island, for $27.4 million in cash. [nWNAS6559]
